ygData.subject: Re: gforce 2
ygData.msgSnippet: Thanks, all, for your responses. Since I can only add pci to my cheap system (looked so nice last year when I knew so little) and my memory is maxed at 256 (I
ygData.messageBody:
Thanks, all, for your responses. Since I can only add pci to my cheap
system (looked so nice last year when I knew so little) and my memory
is maxed at 256 (I really knew way too little), I may follow the
advice to wait for the 4 to come out and grab a 3 at discount.

Or I could win the lottery and buy a real computer.

Barto

--- In EverQuest@y..., "mlockridge01" <MLockridge01@c...> wrote:
> I have an Nvidia tnt2 64 graphics card. PCI. I have seen the gforce
2
> for about $45. I am wondering if I can expect much improved
> performance with the gforce 2. Both are pci, both 32k. I get lots
of
> lag in Rivervale, most of Luclin, and some of the other cities. Not
> everywhere, just where lots of people gather and the backgrounds
are
> graphics intensive.
>
> I don't have the money to go for the gforce 3, and I don't even
know
> if the 3 comes in pci format. I need another hard disk as well as
> doing a graphics upgrade, so the money needs to stay around that
$45.
>
> I would want a very obvious improvement to even bother with the
> upgrade on the graphics.
>
> Barto Proudfoot
> Zeb server
